content:
y 5, 2014
												Initially a very two dimensional game that while fun, lacked proper staying power, Killing Floor has grown as it's gone on.The seasonal events and the relatively recent addition of a campaign have helped keep the game from stagnating and kept people obsessed with achievements coming back.Not really a fan of their more recent DLC, adding weapons that tip the balance to favour players who buy DLC is not something I can agree with.The game is only truly fun when you're playing with people who know their stuff, and who communicate and coordinate with one another.  Friends with microphones and reasonable Internet connections are what you need to make this game really work out well.With the afore mentioned companions, it can be a fun game to throw yourself into from time to time, though a less tactical one than Left4Dead.

content:
er 4, 2013
												Killing Floor is a decent game.  The gameplay feels slightly choppy like everything else tripwire has to offer, but the atmosphere and variety of weapons/scenarios makes up for it.  As far as horror games go, it's fairly enjoyable, with the monsters being visceral and haunting.  One of the biggest drawbacks is the lack of an intuitive menu system, one which also makes quickly selecting a weapon in the heat of the moment difficult.  Overall, it's a better-than-average horror game that any fan of the genre should try out.

content:
4, 2014
												I know KF2 is out soon but i had to write this just to hail this astonishment called Killing Floor! I played it nearly 500 hours and sometimes still coming back just to have a good hour. I'm a hardcore singleplayer guy, avoid MP as pest and guess what, this is the only multiplayer game i played continously in the recent years. I actually tried L4D but there was so much hate towards me as a newby i quit it. So Killing Floor. At first it looked like a trash. Then dunno how it sucked me in. Few enemies, all the maps has the same goal to kill everything (objective mode was came much later, still only applies to a very few levels), the weapons looks good though. So that's all? Yes! Try it! Not once but try it 10 times and you will start to feel the same thing, a fonding, a calling word 'Come back to mommy and pappy and kill us . . .if you can!"No matter how experienced i am after 500 hours if i'm not carefull enough even the singlest Clot can kill me. This everyday challenge, the weird-scary enemies and level design, the parodical amount of gore, the unbelievable good weapon system and the actual weapons and the teamwork is what makes this game one of the best games ever, and for me, the absolutely king of the multiplayer FPS genre.

content:
19, 2015
												Killing Floor is one of the greatest cooperative game to ever come out on Steam. Is it really? Definitely. Since the game was debut in 2009, Killing Floor evolved with many seasonal events, free weapons and maps, and small cosmetic downloadable content to support Tripwire Interactive's longevity to Killing Floor. One would ask: What is Killing Floor? Well, Killing Floor is a six player multiplayer cooperative survival game that takes on against various "zeds", ranging from the clots to the rage-meter Fleshpound that will grind your body into giblets. There are seven perks that you can select that varies from the Support Specialist with its ultimate shotgun barrage to the fast running Berserker that you will probably become the "ultimate ninja" if you play long enough (Berserker is my favorite perk to use; it's really fun). The game may become a bit repetitious, but the maps, playing with your friends, or meeting (and making friends) with other players in the Killing Floor community will make you come back and enjoy killing those zeds. Did I mention zed time (or slow motion)? There is and seeing zeds being decimated is an appeal to the eyes. The last question remains: Do you have this game in your Steam library? If not, go get this game..now! If you already have KF, go join in a server and have fun. For those who are waiting for Killing Floor 2, I will see you there when it comes out on Day One. Get this game and enjoy it as much as you can before the Patriarch attacks again in Killing Floor 2.

content:
er 27, 2013
												Kinda like Left 4 Dead, but minus the brains (post-post-modernist zombie reference wholly unintended).     If you like shooting ducks in a gallery, but prefer your ducks to look like monsters, then this may very well get you hot and bothered. Stand in a group and shoot things, run to the nearest "shop", spend money on better equipment, then run to the next shooting gallery and take down yet another "wave" of critters slightly different from the last.  Repeat about ten times, then get a Boss.     No strategy or semblance of a plot or journey like Left 4 Dead, and virtually no significance at all to the fact that you have anyone playing with you (at least where the gameplay's concerned; but I suppose you can always have a nice chat about the weather or the football or something).     Oh, and you can buy silly chicken suits and other inane ♥♥♥♥, a la Team Fortress, etc.  Who needs remotely varied or challenging gameplay when you have silly chicken suits?  Damn, I hate it when I argue against myself and win...Verdict: 6.5/10.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
19, 2015
												Killing Floor is one of the greatest cooperative game to ever come out on Steam. Is it really? Definitely. Since the game was debut in 2009, Killing Floor evolved with many seasonal events, free weapons and maps, and small cosmetic downloadable content to support Tripwire Interactive's longevity to Killing Floor. One would ask: What is Killing Floor? Well, Killing Floor is a six player multiplayer cooperative survival game that takes on against various "zeds", ranging from the clots to the rage-meter Fleshpound that will grind your body into giblets. There are seven perks that you can select that varies from the Support Specialist with its ultimate shotgun barrage to the fast running Berserker that you will probably become the "ultimate ninja" if you play long enough (Berserker is my favorite perk to use; it's really fun). The game may become a bit repetitious, but the maps, playing with your friends, or meeting (and making friends) with other players in the Killing Floor community will make you come back and enjoy killing those zeds. Did I mention zed time (or slow motion)? There is and seeing zeds being decimated is an appeal to the eyes. The last question remains: Do you have this game in your Steam library? If not, go get this game..now! If you already have KF, go join in a server and have fun. For those who are waiting for Killing Floor 2, I will see you there when it comes out on Day One. Get this game and enjoy it as much as you can before the Patriarch attacks again in Killing Floor 2.

content:
7, 2014
												This is a game you shouldn't play at night. I play it often with my friends, and im either doing REALLY bad or im doing REALLY good. It tends to be the first. I love playing this game with friends because I know 70% of the time I can rely on them. The other 30% they are trying to screw me up. I had this one glorious moment where I was the lone survivor on Medium Difficulty and there were 50 or so monsters left, + a Fleshpound and 3 scrakes. I was out of ammo, it was an intense 10 minutes of me running around, self healing, and shooting the FP every now and then. I am the person on the team who doesnt wanna go against a Scrake let alone 3 and a FP, but I did it. The rest were easy, and I saved my team. The next round I died within a minute. Thats how this game can change. I love the speed of it, the graphics, the controls, and the multiplay. No way I could play this on my own. I scare so easily T_T. I would give this game an 8.5/10 :)  Its definetly a game to play with friends, I recommend it for people who have 5 good friends you know you can mess around with, and have a good shooting time. I just hope you aren't afraid of the darkness.

content:
er 28, 2011
												First of all, I want to say that do not compare this game with Left 4 Dead series, they are completely different styles. Apparently KF seems to be a game that people will love or hate. In KF the objective is to survive against “waves" of enemies, with each wave becoming successively more difficult, until it concludes in the last wave against the Patriarch (the final boss). Between waves you can buy weapons, armor, grenades, etc. One of the things that I like more about this game is the "Zed Time”, it's something like the "bullet-time" in the Matrix movies and Max Payne games, you can see everything in “slow motion” for a few seconds, even in multiplayer. Graphics? They aren't the best, but IMO it doesn't matter, unless, of course, you are a graphic ♥♥♥♥♥?On other hand, I love Tripwire, they are one of the best and few PC-exclusive developers out there, and also because KF was released almost 3 years ago and they constantly are updating the game with free stuff.8.5/10

content:
26, 2013
												The best co-op game I've played!KF is basically waves of different zombies coming to get you and nomnomnom you to death.It doesn’t sound too complicated and it’s not. Don’t mix up simplicity with fun though – I don’t see any dependency here.Everything depends on who you play with and everybody’s play style. This is the factor that could make you rage or laugh or chill during the whole game. I’ve experienced one and the same map and difficulty to be easy, extremely hard, annoying or raging, all depending on who I play with. What the game is like? As I said – waves and different zombies. There are also 6 classes you can play as and all of them have different strengths and weaknesses, as well as different nemeses in the face of the different zombie types. There are no skills that you can choose from, so all who choose to play a certain class are equal (at least until the point when it comes to skills, situation assessment and general play style). Weapons are also divided in classes, but there is no restriction if you feel like buying a weapon meant for a class different than yours.

												Honestly such a great game. For $4.99 give or take it's so fun. Co-op especially. Playing with friends is so fun and the monsters when I first got the game scared the crap out of me. Amazingly, I don't have such a great computer yet on lowest settings 16:9 1280x720 I can run the game smoothly just barely getting around 90 FPS. PC SPECS:CPU (API): AMD A4-5000GPU (CHIP): AMD 8330 HD GraphicsRAM: 8.00 GB DDR2/DDR3 (can't remember)I love this game so much, I'm sure I'd probably have frame issues if I bought Killing Floor 2, but I can easily upgrade to a different PC. The rush I have getting into a level is amazing. Hardly any games I play now-a-days give me the rush this game does. I can't wait 'till I get better at this game so that I can play on a harder difficulty and get an EVEN BIGGER adrenaline rush.Thank you so very much for creating this game. I'm glad it was made, and by the right people.

content:
0, 2016
Killing Floor is a challenging and fun FPS survival game in which your goal is to survive 10 waves of zombies and defeat the final boss - Patriarch. Each wave brings in even more zombies that you haven't seen in previous waves before. In addition, every specimen (zombie) is diverse and has unique behavior traits and abilities that you need to be aware of to increase your chances of winning. Besides, playing in a higher difficulty some specimens in certain situations may cause trouble even for a veteran so you shouldn't take them lightly as they're even stronger in hordes and narrow places.There are 7 in-game perks (classes) which specialize in different weapons and possess certain bonuses. All perks have 7 levels (starting from level 0 and maxing out at 6), while being higher level you get access to better bonuses. In order to gain experience you have to perform particular actions, the most common of which being to deal damage with weapons specific to that perk but also includes other actions like welding or healing. Having different perks in your team is a key to survival as teamwork is what this game is all about unless you're up for a challenge and want to try completing the map alone.If the game starts to get boring you're always free to try the objective mode. It's similar to standard mode but you must complete various tasks like restoring lost power or keeping NPC alive to finish the map. Also, there's a good amount of achievements, DLCs and a workshop with tons of community-made weapons, characters, specimens, maps and game modes. What really stood out for me in this game was sarcastic British banter and hype rock and D&B music during gameplay.Despite the fact that this game is currently 7 years old, graphics aren't that crummy and it's still possible to find people to play with.9.5/10

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
er 21, 2016
												I'm not good at writing reviews, but it feels criminal to love a game this much and not leave a positive review on it, so here's' a simple pros/cons listPros:+Great soundtrack+Weapons feel powerful and satisfying to fire (a feature somewhat lacking in KF2, in my opinion)+Gritty, sinister 'apocalyptic' atmosphere to the maps, as opposed to the oddly clean, shiny and futuristic feel of KF2+Full of personality+Fast-paced+Challenging, assuming you're not playing on lower difficulties. Not a hand-holding game.+Many different weapons and perks to try+Easy to sink countless hours into without it becoming 'stale' or 'old' (somewhat subjective)+Many different official and community maps+Not at all demanding and can be played on low-end systems, but at the same time, the graphics really aren't bad for a 2009 gameCons:-Likely to become less active with KF2 being out-Progressing in perks can feel grindy at times, but is well worth the effort-Very minor bugs existOverall, Killing Floor is still vastly superior to KF2 (though KF2 is not a bad game by any means), and is well worth the money for anyone who enjoys co-op survival or horde shooters.

content:
y 22
												The graphics are 2009 quality, leveling up is a grind and the Patriarch (boss that you fight after last wave) is brutally hard to concur. The main gamemode is called "Killing Floor". Waves of various Zed's come out to get you cause they're mad and they get more difficult and increase in numbers as you progress. There is also an "Objective Mode" which is an entertaining and addictive change from the normal fight the waves of Zeds mode.  Killing Floor wouldn't be anything without it's weapon perk system. As you figure out what your play style is (Medic, Shotgun, Melee, Pistols, etc.) you can aim to level up your preferred perk to make killing zed's easier. There are only 5 or 6 levels per perk but as I said earlier, leveling up is a bit of a grind.  The british humor, the blood, the gore, the perk system, the horror you feel when you run into a scrake or a fleshpound and the Trader who is constantly hitting on you and your teammates with sexual innuendos (She likes the big ones, btw) are all things that really seperates this game apart from others of its time. It's most enjoyable with friends or online but I find solo play to also be challenging and fun.If you don't have enough dosh to buy this game wait for when it goes on sale as it goes on sale fairly often and buy some DLC too while you're at it. I recommend the weapons packs.

content:
9, 2016
												It's challenging and rewarding and loads more fun than KF2.There is a wide range of weapons to use on all perks which allows for various strategies and playstyles. And after you've become tired of the base game weapons, you can purchase more weapons via dlc packs. And the dlc weapons are either reskins or whole new weapons, so it adds even more variety. I've been playing with just the base game weapons, if I want to use the dlc weapons, I can trade them off someone and paying them dosh for it (in-game currency). So, no real money is really needed to use dlc weapons as long as you play with someone who has them!Zeds are interesting and challenging, it will take practice to understand various strategies on killing them. It's not always as simple as shooting them, some bigger zeds might require specific strategies to kill effectively. And if you get bored of base game zeds, you can play against 3 reskinned themes including halloween, hillbilly, and christmas zeds. If that's not enough, there are custom mod servers out there with brand new zeds and weapons. You need only join these custom servers and the game will do the rest for you (downloading them and such).The music is metal and it's nice to listen to. Personally, I turn the music off when I play because it's easier to hear zeds behind you without screaming metal blasting in the background.Pros:Lots of weaponsChallenging enemiesFun teamplay elementsMoney managementChat commands are often funny or informative (i.e. Insult Players)You can get dlc weapons off other players (no purchase of dlc required)No sprint (some people say this is a con but I think it's a pro because it adds desperation and challenge to a given situation. I think sprint in KF2 ruined the experience.)High recoil on weaponsCons:Metal music can be distracting if you're not watching your backLobby ads can get really annoying (there are mods to change/disable them)Menu buttons are sometimes a little wonky (requiring a second or third click)Neutral:Dark filter makes colours seem dull but it increases the gritty atmosphereTrader dialogue gets on my nerves sometimes (personal preference so not a con)Modding sounds or music will change it for singleplayer but not onlineOnly one boss but his diologue is funnySome strategies are kind of cheesy but fun to do yourself (i.e. blowing up boss with a few dozen demo charges)I can't think of anything else to add but it's definately a golden title of a game, I highly recommend it. 10/10

content:
er 24, 2016
Product received for free
												My friend gifted me the vanilla copy of this game two years ago. And I still play it to this day. I love this game; And I love this franchise. This game has meant the world to me. I've made so many wonderful and lasting friendships with this community, and various players I've met through my two years of service. :3 With over 683 hours into this game. I still find myself wanting to come back for more. The gameplay is simple to understand. You fight through ten waves of enemies; with each wave, increasing in enemy population, and difficulty. Then the eleventh wave is the boss wave. You are given a wage for every enemy you kill, and for each wave you survive. After each wave, you are given a minute or two to run to the trader, and procure more crucial supplies like ammunition, body armor, and progressively better weapons. There are 7 playable classes (or perks as the game refers them) with their own tactical advantages, disadvantages, and tier based weaponry. They all play a part in aiding the team in surviving the hordes of zeds that you will be facing. There are 10 (11 if you play on custom servers) different enemy types with their own advantages, and disadvantages. After a while, the enemy scripting becomes REALLY easy to exploit. But this has never bothered me. I've always enjoyed cutting a bloody swathe through hordes of zeds with my guns, and my friends :3 The graphics by today's standards arent enough to really wow anyone. The gameplay and community has always been this game's strong suit in my mind.This game has always been a staple in my library ever since it was gifted to me. And it recieves my personal seal of approval.  I hope that this review has helped you in your purchasing decision, or reassured you of the purchase that you have just made. Thank you for your time, and I hope to see you on the Killing Floor!!Iajibagoa; Signing out.//Edits made: Removed emotes that didnt show up in original version of review.

er 14, 2014
												6-Man Co-op shooter against waves of increasingly strong Zeds. Soon to be a decade old, this game still has a bunch of people playing. Never do I log on and don't see servers of my chosen difficulty.Pros:-Awesome Fun-7 Perks to choose from, each requires a good xp grind to hit max rank-Tons of maps and a good selection of weapons to use-Huge modding community adding maps/weapons/skins-Tripwire still updates the game with Holiday events and new DLC equipementCons:-Modding Character/weapon skins will sometimes disable perk progression until the game is launched again -Higher difficulty = more enemies that have even more HP and move faster-Due to the Xp grind, a casual player may not level up for months when trying to hit the higher ranks9 types of zeds will make their appearance during your games. Each zed is unique and will try to eat you in some fashion. Where the basic clot is no threat alone, being cornered by a fleshpound can definitly ruin your day. Some zeds require coordination to take out, as does kiting the map if you don't have the fire power to camp one spot. For the fun factor and survivability, this game is definitly worth it's price. Killing Floor 2 is on it's way, time to practice zed disposal!

I recommend that game to everyone, honestly. You can't go wrong with this one. I also like how there's so many achievments you could get during playing this game. And what's most important, when you get a good team together, you will gain many great friends from that game as well. 10 out of 10 from me :D Thumbs Up!

												Killing Floor, to me, is one of the best co-op designed games I've played to date. The game brings out all the classic, well-known weapons of shooters into the mix. Killing Floor revolves and works around how many players are in the game (1-6) and each wave of enemies increases in numbers the further you get. The more people that are in the server, the harder the final Patriarch boss is to kill.The game has many classes and plenty of characters to choose from and you can level them up from 0-6 as you play them more frequently. If you're looking for a game that has all sorts of classes that master in almost any type of weapon out there, Killing Floor is the game for you. Perfect for when your only objective is to just kill things with your friends!

content:
30, 2014
												This game is one of the best FPS Co-Op ever made. In fact, it may be the best Co-op ever made. It's certainly the best one I've ever played.If you've ever read any of my other reviews, you know that something special is coming if I start like that...So. Yes, it's an older game (2011 I believe). I'm glad we've got that out of the way. The graphics do feel a tiny bit dated, but they are clean, and you soon forget about it.Admittedly, I haven't played it for a while, so I'm a little bit rusty, as some of the small things I love about the game probably won't be posted here, but I just realised I haven't written a review for it, and it really needs one. So in one sentence, what makes this a great game is"Truly co-operative gameplay"That's it, right there, in just 3 words.There's lots of other little mechanics that make it interesting, and sometimes slightly difficult to get into (in other words there's a little bit of a learning curve), and what it truly gets right is team-based gameplay. Allow me to explain;I think I better begin with what this game actually is.The Basics;Basically, it's a Player Vs Environment 1st person shooter for 1 to 6 players to work in a team. In this case, the environment happens to be waves of Zeds (clones that strangely seem to resemble zombies). Those waves begin with weaker creature types, and build up in a variety, difficulty, and number of enemies in each wave. Between waves you make your way to a shop to upgrade your weapons. Anyone who died during the wave, respawn's at this point, as long as one person from the team is still alive. The final wave has a "big Boss" who can heal himself a couple of times and throws small waves at you while he is healing. If you do enough damage to him, you can kill him before he can run off to heal. That's the basics. There's a huge variety of the maps, with more being released often, in the developers are still working on making this a better game even though they're about to release the new version. That says a lot for the developer.A little bit about the mechanics of the game;So, 1st person shooter. We've got that much sorted. You choose a "Perk", (otherwise known as a Class) including Medic, sniper, support, Pyro, berserker, assault. Each class has its strengths and weaknesses, each class can choose any type of weapon, but you get additional bonuses for using weapons that your class is designed for, for example snipers get extra head shot damage while using rifles, berserker's get a 30% speed boost while using a melee weapon (axes/swords etc).More Mechanics;You start with a pistol (and a completely useless knife), and that the end of each wave you go to a trading floor where you can buy bigger and better weapons. You do have a weight restriction so you can only purchase so many weapons, and the more weight you have, the more your movement speed is slowed down (this is only very minor).The more you play a perk, the better your perks get… Basically an unlock system, there are 6 levels to unlock for each perk, and the higher the level of your perk the cheaper your weapons get to purchase in the game, and the better bonuses you get on your weapons. At level 6 perk, you spawn with another weapon besides just a pistol.The most important aspects of this game, are voice communication and teamwork. And that, right there, is why I love this game so much. Everyone that plays this game, wants to be part of the team. There are very few 12 year olds screaming "n00b scrub”(a.k.a. none), and very few "Rambo hero's".Teamwork; People call when they need to swap positions, when they're low on ammunition, or when a Z that needs a different class to deal with it turns up.If you die, you lose everything but;Your friends can pick the stuff up off your dead body and give it back to you.Your friends can drop money for you, see you can buy more weapons.There are different classes, each with definite strengths and weaknesses, and you need a combination of them in order to be successful. For example, snipers are good at picking off big strong guys at a distance, and supports (with the many shotguns) are much better suited to wave clearing the smaller guys. A sniper plus support combo will do a lot better than 2 snipers.Anyone can heal anyone, including themselves, but healing yourself does 50%, healing a teammate does 100%.Headset microphone are a must for this game.Map design;There is a huge amount of variety in the maps, including some community-based built ones. One of the most interesting aspects of the map design, is that maps tend to be largely "circular", it's very difficult to find a corner that you can hide in a shoot everything from one direction, there's almost always more than one way for them to get in, and one of those ways is directly behind you at any time -thus, teamwork. This particular mechanic of the game actually does something to make it something special.The Trader;Also known as the shop. This is another interesting mechanic, which while making the game easier (read: the guns) also makes it harder. How? Because there are several spawn points for the Trader on the map, often on opposite sides of the map. This makes it more difficult, because if you do happen to have a good little spot, you have to run to the other side of the map so you can buy more ammunition, supplies, and guns. Once you are familiar with how the Trader works, it's actually a very easy system to choosing the weapons and classes that you want. It's very well implemented. And the mechanic of the Trader moving, really makes it feel like you're on the run from the Zeds. There is a time limit on getting to the shop and purchasing items, this time limit is triggered on the last Zeds’ death. Keep the last one alive until everyone gets to the shop.Difficulty levels;The more people in the team, the more Zeds you have to face together. For example, one person would face 10 Zeds, 2 people would face 25 Zeds. Difficulty levels are set by the server, so you can tell what difficulty level is before you log in. Difficulty is ramped up in a few ways, the Zeds get more health, they get faster, there are more of them in a wave, and they can do more damage. Also, you have less time to get to the shop and buy. The hardest difficulties are called "suicide" and "hell on earth" for a reason.Storyline;Some random scientist was experimenting on humans and made clones, which got out of control went on a rampage and killed lots of people. You and your team get paid to go in and clear out these infestations. The big boss happens to be That Scientist. That's the whole storyline, right there. Now go shoot some Zeds.New players;I highly and thoroughly recommend that new players spend a significant amount of time in "solo" mode, which is the single player mode of the game. I'd suggest getting each class to level II before you jump online, but at the very least you need to get each class to level I.Key bindings;These are the changes that I made, I feel that they make the game more intuitive. I disable weapons selection of via middle mouse button, and I use the numbers 1 through 4 keys for that purpose.I use mouse scroll to throw money. It is much easier to roll the mouse, than trying to spam a button.I set voice communication to my thumb (back button) on the mouse.I did a re-bind of my right mouse button, and changed it from toggle weapons to zoom, to Quick Iron Sights.Wow. I ran out of room. I had m...

content:
21, 2015
Intro Killing Floor is a Co-op survival Shoot 'em up were you have 10 waves of specimens (zombies) and you and your team have to simply survive and kill all the specimens. This is the hole game which seems like it will soon get boring after while but because its done so well you can play the game for hours at a time.Good Points One of Killing Floors best things is the replay value since you can play for hours at a time. There are a massive amount of maps to choose from, events such as Christmas and Halloween, 100s of Achievements and a massive amount of fun. These things put together makes great replay value. Guns is a big part in Killing Floor because you will always use them to shoot and kill every specimen you see. Its very satisfying and never gets old, there are loads of weapons to pick from so you cant get bored of them. The controls are simple in a good way, they are not very hard to get used to and you will know everyone after an hour. Specimens are really unique and they all have there own special abilities, there are 10 different types of specimens and thats not including the boss at the end. This always keeps the game play going and makes each game feel different. Killing Floor is a very challenging game to start off with, but as you play you will get better and start playing different difficulty which can be really hard. You will die a lot but that gives you more reason to keep playing because you want to beat the level. The length of the game depends of how long you want to play it. You can keep playing for a long as you want and most of the time you wont get bored. Some people manage to put 1000s of hours into Killing Floor and still play to this day. The price it worth it but its always on sale every couple of months so I would recommend waiting a little bit since you can save a bit of dosh. There are six different classes to choose from such as Sharpshooter to Firebug. There is a class that suits you which you can level up to get better at the class, this helps and keeps you playing. The Killing Floor community are really nice and will help you get Achievements as well as helping you in any other way they can. The game is over 5 years old and people are still playing in the thousands which is rare for most games.Bad Points As I said about the game being over 5 years old, this means the game may soon die within a year of two. As well and Killing Floor 2 coming out this means it will never be as big as it was. But its still worth the money for now since you will get enjoyment out of the game.OverallOverall I think that Killing Floor is a great fun game to play with friends and wont get boring, its considered a classing for PC gamers and is still great fun today. I would recommend this game to anyone who has Steam. I would give Killing Floor 9 out of 10.

content:
ry 17
												I've always maintained that a game had to either be really creative(on story, game mechanics, art, or the like) or have a really high budget to be successful or fun. Killing Floor completely disproves both. Co-op zombie survival in waves with breaks in between to purchase weapons isn't new. In fact, this type of game could be considered to be the antithesis of creativity, as it also has absolutely no unique features whatsoever. The game looks like it was created by a 12 year old with Unity assets over the course of a week. The graphics are absolutely horrendous(just like many other games, it looks worse than on the screenshots), the physics are awkward, the sounds are bland and the UI isn't any better. Nothing about this game would make it seem worth buying.So why can't I stop playing Killing Floor? Why can't any of the other 96% of people who recommend this game to others, for that matter? I don't know. Buy the game and see for yourself- clearly there must be a reason, no?

content:
er 25, 2013
												On easy mode, it's a fun little co-op shoot-the-things game with waves and a boss. And in-depth character classes. And skills progression. And hilariously bad British voice acting. And totally not zombies. On any harder difficulty, it's an excersize in computer-smashing frustration and shouting matches between teammates while idiots abound trying to tell you exactly how to play their way. On easy mode it's mostly calm and relaxed (relatively, this is a not-zombie game after all) and the most heated it gets is when you get mobbed by fifty things at once (in which case you either a. shoot or stab your way out or b. throw all your grenades at your feet and take all those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s with you.) On harder modes it's simply a hopeless fight against you with a dinky peashooter (and a lever-action rifle, IF YOU'RE LUCKY...) against bullet-sponge enemies who move at twice your speed and can all but insta-kill you. On easy mode... you know what, I think I've made my point. Get this game.  Play with friends. Or strangers. On easy mode, okay?

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
2015
												I really love this game. Is it kind of a grind? Yea but if you really hate the grind, you can easily DL a perk leveler map and train your stats if it bothers you that much.Is this game repetitive? Sure but that's also a key factor which makes it great. You know what is going to happen but on the harder levels, the antsy feeling of running away and shooting or barricading yourself in somewhere never goes away and that's awesome.Really just a big sandbox game. A lot of fun without friends but if you have friends, it is way more fun. The teamwork you get on some servers to stick together and watch everyone's backs is awesome and hilarious. I put this game down sometimes because of how repetitive it is but I always come back for more. Hopefully Killing Floor 2 will just learn from the few mistakes this game had and make a better version.If i were to recommend a game that's wave-based, shoot-em-up with twenty-five or more guns that you use efficiently against armies of failed experiments that give you bounty cash when you kill them, so you can kill that in horrifically more brutal ways with better guns, as they slowly upgrade their army with bigger baddies until you fight an all-mighty boss that could rekt you without blinking, I'd recommend Killing Floor. Seriously, this game is my TOP FAVORITE, just because of how enjoyable it is. Yes, it may be old, and yes, it's not graphically impressive, but it's a damn good game. It has me STILL playing, even after hitting rank six with every class and gaining every annoying ♥♥♥♥ing achievement.Why do i keep playing? Because it's fun, and because my friends have/love it. Playing by yourself on Hell on Earth, doesn't compare to the simple mayhem of playing with 6, or 64 other players (depending on what player-based mods are installed.) And, if you don't like the original ZEDS, you can re-mold them with extremely well-done mods like the Killing Floor: Dead Space mod, or the Aliens mod, to fight more horrific creatures. Hell, they even have mods to make the game ALMOST like DOOM. There is weapon mods, character re-skins, maps, VEHICLES, and so many other amazing things. This game gets a 10/10, no matter how people string the BS. It's a great game, and has some amazing re-play value when you're trying new things out. Multiplayer is fun, single player is fun, and PLEASE don't say that popping a ZED's head of with a M99 ISN'T satisfying. 10/10 best zombie shooter genre game of 2009-2015 (KF 2 EA in april of 2015)

er 19, 2013
												I don't even know why I haven't reviewed this game yet, despite having (Probably) spent more time in it than any other game in my library. Really, what else is there to say than, it's fun! Not just the game is good but so it it's community, in most cases. I recalled plenty of moments where after a wave I was short on cash, only to feel a smile tugging at my lips when a random person ran up to me and started throwing dosh at my face while yelling the game's characteristic “Loadsa moneh!”  There's beginner mode which is easy and can help any starting player learn the ropes, getting their first perk levels while chopping off specimen heads left and right, is there's one thing bad about it, is that from beginner to normal is such a huge jump, making the game suddenly feel rather, difficult for new players. It does however do well at making the players work together. Two people working as a team can wreak havoc in hard mode whereas six people that don't will only end up failing in normal. I like that.Every match can last anywhere from 3 minutes (If you die early) to 45 minutes (On long games) and whether you win or not, you'll still most often know that you made some progress levelling towards your next perk level.It will probably go on sale again this winter, and the monsters will all look their christmassy best again (They already do!) so if you have a bit of dosh. Get it, bring some friends, and get hunting!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 26, 2014
												Killing floor was released in 2005 and was developed and published by Tripwire Interactive. There is also a sequel to this game comming out in 2015, there are also various trailors for Killing floor  but talking about that would be going off topic. I will be talking about alot of the game features and you may not have time to read all of it or you might just not want to, you can skip to the final paragraph to read the final verdict. Killing floor is a zombie wave base survival game. You can play solo, or co-op with up to 6 other players. There are 5 difficulties you can play on - Beginner, Normal, Hard, Suicidal and finally Hell On Earth. There is a large variety of maps to play on, and you can also download many more maps on the steam work shop. There are seven different classes you can play as, as you play the game there are different challanges to do for each perk, which when completed will level up your perk. The highest level you can get a perk to is level 6. At a level 5 and 6 perk, you spawn with a weapon unique to the class you as. For example if you are a berserker you will spawn with an axe, where as if you were level 1-4 you would spawn with what everyone else who is level 1-4 spawns with. Some classes even allow you to spawn with a protective vest at level 5 or 6. The seven classes you can play as are the Field Medic, the Support Specialist, the Sharpshooter, the Commando, the Berserker, the Firebug and Demolitions. All these classes play in different ways.The gameplay is based around surviving waves on enemies, and each wave there are more enemies, and at some higher waves better enemies spawn. After a wave is completed you have a minute to a minute and a half (depending on the dificulty) to get to a trader and buy weapons or ammo. You can change the number of waves from short, medium, long or custom. Short game consists of 4 waves on enemies, and then a fifth wave which is the boss wave. A medium wave has 7 waves of normal enemies, and then an 8th wave which is the boss wave. A long game has 10 rounds of normal enemies and then an 11th wave which is the boss round. After you kill the boss on the final round you will be awarded with an achievment (if it is the first time you have completed that map on every difficulty exept beginner) and even if you are dead you will still get the achievment. The graphics in this game are not the best, but these graphics were good for their time, let me remind you this game was made in 2005. You can alter the graphics with various options from the menu which do improve the looks of this game. There are 10 enemies in this game. You may think they are zombies but they are in fact specimens, they are failed experimental clones. The 10 specimens are called the Clot, Crawler, Gorefast, Stalker, Bloat, Husk, Siren, Scrake, Fleshpound and the boss from the final wave - The Patriach. The clot is the easiest of the enemies but has the ability to grab you (unless you are a high level berserker), this can be bad in close quaters situations or when you are being swarmed. The crawler (as you can imagine it crawls) is a small black thing with multiple legs and its main attack involves it jumping at you, making it a hard target to shoot. The gorefast, is a red enemy who has a blade in one of his hands, if you let him get to close to you, he will rage and run at you super fast and he can do some serious damage. The Stalker is a female enemy who goes stealth and strikes you from behind, if succesful it can do alot of damamge. The bloat, is a big fat green/yellow guy and one of his attacks if vometing, this poisons you and deals you damage over time, not a long time but it can still be dangerous, he also soaks up quite a few bullets but if you get head shots on him and can be a quick kill. The husk has a husk fireball launcher (a weapon the pyro can buy), he shoots at you from far, but he still tries to walk close to you, if he gets close to you, he will use his melee attack and hit you. The siren is a female enemy who walks fairly slowly but get close to her and you wont hear the end of it, her main attack is screaming, this muffles you visition and does you alot of damamge at higher difficuilties, she should definity be one of the first enemies you try to kill if you are kiting. The scrake looks like a butcher with a hockey mask, he has a chainsaw and if you get to close to him, he will go into a rage mode and run really fast, he can be really deadly if you dont stun him. The fleshpound is the hardest and most deadliest enemy not including the final boss. Up to three fleshpounds can come at once which is really bad. Fleshpounds are much like scrakes or gorefasts, if you get to close to ther fleshpound he will go rage, he will go from the colour yellow, to the colour red and he will charge at you really fast, he also has alot of hit points. The final enemy is the Patriach, he is also the boss for the final round (other monsters also spawn on the final round while the patriach is healing). He has many attacks, he can shoot a rocket at you, he can shoot is arm gun at you, he can melee you and he can also go stealth (which he does alot). He will be in stealth alot but if you damamge him with a fire weapon you can see the flames moving around in the shape on him, which indicates to you where he is. He has alot of hit points and the best stratgy to kill him is to be the demolition class and place pipe bombs at the entrancers to doors, but make sure he cant see you are he will shoot and posibily detonate the pipe bombs. Co-op can be played with up to six other players, but if you play on modded servers i have seen one with up to 32 players. If more players join the game more enemies spawn and the enemies get slightly harder, but if you want to win some games and are not a very experienced player, i recomend to look for a server and play co-op to get use to the game. In co-op you can share guns with team mates and share money, by share i mean you drop them and then your team mates pick them up. You can not revive team mates so if you die you will spawn at the end of the round. Weapons are class specific, but you can find weapons scatered around the map along with ammo and if your lucky a vest. The weapons you buy will be cheaper if you are a higher level in the class you are playing as. Some weapons have an alternet shoot. For example if you have a medic gun you can shoot uneing the alternate shoot mode and if you shoot at a team mate you will heal them. Or as a berserker with melee weapons you can stun enemies, for exaple you can stun a husk by using the alternate attack. My final verdict for this game is a 9/10. It has amazing co-op, a deep class/perk system, a wide variety of enemies and guns, so many maps, maps on the steam workshop, the ability to play solo, 5 different dificulties, lots of achievments, a challanging boss (on harder difficulties), collectibles hidden within maps, different skins which you can buy or get from achievments, custom servers. All in all it is a great game and i totally recommend you buy it, or atleest watch a video to see if it peaks your interest :)

er 19, 2013
												I don't even know why I haven't reviewed this game yet, despite having (Probably) spent more time in it than any other game in my library. Really, what else is there to say than, it's fun! Not just the game is good but so it it's community, in most cases. I recalled plenty of moments where after a wave I was short on cash, only to feel a smile tugging at my lips when a random person ran up to me and started throwing dosh at my face while yelling the game's characteristic “Loadsa moneh!”  There's beginner mode which is easy and can help any starting player learn the ropes, getting their first perk levels while chopping off specimen heads left and right, is there's one thing bad about it, is that from beginner to normal is such a huge jump, making the game suddenly feel rather, difficult for new players. It does however do well at making the players work together. Two people working as a team can wreak havoc in hard mode whereas six people that don't will only end up failing in normal. I like that.Every match can last anywhere from 3 minutes (If you die early) to 45 minutes (On long games) and whether you win or not, you'll still most often know that you made some progress levelling towards your next perk level.It will probably go on sale again this winter, and the monsters will all look their christmassy best again (They already do!) so if you have a bit of dosh. Get it, bring some friends, and get hunting!

content:
er 3, 2013
												Personally, when I started this game I expected more, based on its sample images and opinions I had heard: graphics, environments and monsters feel outdated for today's standards and not in a good way as with cult-classic games like Doom (it does originate from an Unreal Tournament 2004 mod after all), however the more I played it the more it grew on me!If I had to say what makes this game good, since I still stand my ground regarding what I said above about its overall feeling, I would name 3 things: weapons, achievements and online co-op fun!The variety of weapons in this game is amazing, maybe the greatest I've found in an online game, you can really find many kinds of modern and old, existing or non, weapons (maybe it's a bit lacking if you are expecting many futuristic or alien-like weapons, like the ones in Halo, Doom 3 or Unreal Tournament, but its array of "traditional" weapons is really impressive), with new weapons being added each year as DLCs.The achievements, much like the weapons, are not only many and fun to obtain, but increase each year with the so called "events" (there are mainly 3: summer, halloween and christmas), periods in which specific achievements can be obtained, adding to the replay factor.Last but not least, at heart Killing Floor remains a fun co-op game, while maybe not as fun and popular as the Left 4 Dead games, killing monsters with other real players is always a nice experience!

content:
21, 2015
Intro Killing Floor is a Co-op survival Shoot 'em up were you have 10 waves of specimens (zombies) and you and your team have to simply survive and kill all the specimens. This is the hole game which seems like it will soon get boring after while but because its done so well you can play the game for hours at a time.Good Points One of Killing Floors best things is the replay value since you can play for hours at a time. There are a massive amount of maps to choose from, events such as Christmas and Halloween, 100s of Achievements and a massive amount of fun. These things put together makes great replay value. Guns is a big part in Killing Floor because you will always use them to shoot and kill every specimen you see. Its very satisfying and never gets old, there are loads of weapons to pick from so you cant get bored of them. The controls are simple in a good way, they are not very hard to get used to and you will know everyone after an hour. Specimens are really unique and they all have there own special abilities, there are 10 different types of specimens and thats not including the boss at the end. This always keeps the game play going and makes each game feel different. Killing Floor is a very challenging game to start off with, but as you play you will get better and start playing different difficulty which can be really hard. You will die a lot but that gives you more reason to keep playing because you want to beat the level. The length of the game depends of how long you want to play it. You can keep playing for a long as you want and most of the time you wont get bored. Some people manage to put 1000s of hours into Killing Floor and still play to this day. The price it worth it but its always on sale every couple of months so I would recommend waiting a little bit since you can save a bit of dosh. There are six different classes to choose from such as Sharpshooter to Firebug. There is a class that suits you which you can level up to get better at the class, this helps and keeps you playing. The Killing Floor community are really nice and will help you get Achievements as well as helping you in any other way they can. The game is over 5 years old and people are still playing in the thousands which is rare for most games.Bad Points As I said about the game being over 5 years old, this means the game may soon die within a year of two. As well and Killing Floor 2 coming out this means it will never be as big as it was. But its still worth the money for now since you will get enjoyment out of the game.OverallOverall I think that Killing Floor is a great fun game to play with friends and wont get boring, its considered a classing for PC gamers and is still great fun today. I would recommend this game to anyone who has Steam. I would give Killing Floor 9 out of 10.

												On easy mode, it's a fun little co-op shoot-the-things game with waves and a boss. And in-depth character classes. And skills progression. And hilariously bad British voice acting. And totally not zombies. On any harder difficulty, it's an excersize in computer-smashing frustration and shouting matches between teammates while idiots abound trying to tell you exactly how to play their way. On easy mode it's mostly calm and relaxed (relatively, this is a not-zombie game after all) and the most heated it gets is when you get mobbed by fifty things at once (in which case you either a. shoot or stab your way out or b. throw all your grenades at your feet and take all those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s with you.) On harder modes it's simply a hopeless fight against you with a dinky peashooter (and a lever-action rifle, IF YOU'RE LUCKY...) against bullet-sponge enemies who move at twice your speed and can all but insta-kill you. On easy mode... you know what, I think I've made my point. Get this game.  Play with friends. Or strangers. On easy mode, okay?

content:
10, 2015
												Killing Floor is an addictive (optional multiplayer) horde survival game, in which you are placed in an area either by yourself or in a group where you must kill a set amount of "Zeds" in a wave. Zeds are this games version of zombies, humans (the majority of which are actually clones) who have been experimented on in an attempt to create super soldiers. Although this is fairly cliche, what this game lacks in its story it certainly makes up for in gameplay, especially online. The game allows for a large amount of variation in gameplay, with different levelable classes/perks (of which there are 7) and different types of enemies (9 excluding boss) allowing the player to learn to use skills andenemy weaknesses wisely. This also allows the team to work together better, something which is required to survive in harder games. The game features some amazingly gory zed deaths, where you can explode zeds into tiny giblets with grenade launchers or pipe bombs, burn them to a crisp with the flamethrower, or slice their limbs off with a giant claymore. The real highlight of the game though is the zed-time, which allows you to view particularly grisly or skillful kills in slow motion. This is triggered through set kill types, or randomized ones if it doesnt happen for a while, and not only does it look cool but it also gives the team a few seconds to place better shots and therefore kill more zeds, giving the chance to extend the zed-time. The community for this game are also still very active, with steam workshop integration, and new items added to it all the time. This adds even more spice and variety to the gameplay, allowing you to do basically whatever you want. Overall, this game offers amazing gameplay, especially online. However, if you want to buy this game for achievements, look elsewhere. This game requires lots of playing hours to earn the majority of the achievements, which revolve around beating specific maps on certain difficulties and lengths. For anything else though, this game is top notch :)

content:
30, 2014
												This game is one of the best FPS Co-Op ever made. In fact, it may be the best Co-op ever made. It's certainly the best one I've ever played.If you've ever read any of my other reviews, you know that something special is coming if I start like that...So. Yes, it's an older game (2011 I believe). I'm glad we've got that out of the way. The graphics do feel a tiny bit dated, but they are clean, and you soon forget about it.Admittedly, I haven't played it for a while, so I'm a little bit rusty, as some of the small things I love about the game probably won't be posted here, but I just realised I haven't written a review for it, and it really needs one. So in one sentence, what makes this a great game is"Truly co-operative gameplay"That's it, right there, in just 3 words.There's lots of other little mechanics that make it interesting, and sometimes slightly difficult to get into (in other words there's a little bit of a learning curve), and what it truly gets right is team-based gameplay. Allow me to explain;I think I better begin with what this game actually is.The Basics;Basically, it's a Player Vs Environment 1st person shooter for 1 to 6 players to work in a team. In this case, the environment happens to be waves of Zeds (clones that strangely seem to resemble zombies). Those waves begin with weaker creature types, and build up in a variety, difficulty, and number of enemies in each wave. Between waves you make your way to a shop to upgrade your weapons. Anyone who died during the wave, respawn's at this point, as long as one person from the team is still alive. The final wave has a "big Boss" who can heal himself a couple of times and throws small waves at you while he is healing. If you do enough damage to him, you can kill him before he can run off to heal. That's the basics. There's a huge variety of the maps, with more being released often, in the developers are still working on making this a better game even though they're about to release the new version. That says a lot for the developer.A little bit about the mechanics of the game;So, 1st person shooter. We've got that much sorted. You choose a "Perk", (otherwise known as a Class) including Medic, sniper, support, Pyro, berserker, assault. Each class has its strengths and weaknesses, each class can choose any type of weapon, but you get additional bonuses for using weapons that your class is designed for, for example snipers get extra head shot damage while using rifles, berserker's get a 30% speed boost while using a melee weapon (axes/swords etc).More Mechanics;You start with a pistol (and a completely useless knife), and that the end of each wave you go to a trading floor where you can buy bigger and better weapons. You do have a weight restriction so you can only purchase so many weapons, and the more weight you have, the more your movement speed is slowed down (this is only very minor).The more you play a perk, the better your perks get… Basically an unlock system, there are 6 levels to unlock for each perk, and the higher the level of your perk the cheaper your weapons get to purchase in the game, and the better bonuses you get on your weapons. At level 6 perk, you spawn with another weapon besides just a pistol.The most important aspects of this game, are voice communication and teamwork. And that, right there, is why I love this game so much. Everyone that plays this game, wants to be part of the team. There are very few 12 year olds screaming "n00b scrub”(a.k.a. none), and very few "Rambo hero's".Teamwork; People call when they need to swap positions, when they're low on ammunition, or when a Z that needs a different class to deal with it turns up.If you die, you lose everything but;Your friends can pick the stuff up off your dead body and give it back to you.Your friends can drop money for you, see you can buy more weapons.There are different classes, each with definite strengths and weaknesses, and you need a combination of them in order to be successful. For example, snipers are good at picking off big strong guys at a distance, and supports (with the many shotguns) are much better suited to wave clearing the smaller guys. A sniper plus support combo will do a lot better than 2 snipers.Anyone can heal anyone, including themselves, but healing yourself does 50%, healing a teammate does 100%.Headset microphone are a must for this game.Map design;There is a huge amount of variety in the maps, including some community-based built ones. One of the most interesting aspects of the map design, is that maps tend to be largely "circular", it's very difficult to find a corner that you can hide in a shoot everything from one direction, there's almost always more than one way for them to get in, and one of those ways is directly behind you at any time -thus, teamwork. This particular mechanic of the game actually does something to make it something special.The Trader;Also known as the shop. This is another interesting mechanic, which while making the game easier (read: the guns) also makes it harder. How? Because there are several spawn points for the Trader on the map, often on opposite sides of the map. This makes it more difficult, because if you do happen to have a good little spot, you have to run to the other side of the map so you can buy more ammunition, supplies, and guns. Once you are familiar with how the Trader works, it's actually a very easy system to choosing the weapons and classes that you want. It's very well implemented. And the mechanic of the Trader moving, really makes it feel like you're on the run from the Zeds. There is a time limit on getting to the shop and purchasing items, this time limit is triggered on the last Zeds’ death. Keep the last one alive until everyone gets to the shop.Difficulty levels;The more people in the team, the more Zeds you have to face together. For example, one person would face 10 Zeds, 2 people would face 25 Zeds. Difficulty levels are set by the server, so you can tell what difficulty level is before you log in. Difficulty is ramped up in a few ways, the Zeds get more health, they get faster, there are more of them in a wave, and they can do more damage. Also, you have less time to get to the shop and buy. The hardest difficulties are called "suicide" and "hell on earth" for a reason.Storyline;Some random scientist was experimenting on humans and made clones, which got out of control went on a rampage and killed lots of people. You and your team get paid to go in and clear out these infestations. The big boss happens to be That Scientist. That's the whole storyline, right there. Now go shoot some Zeds.New players;I highly and thoroughly recommend that new players spend a significant amount of time in "solo" mode, which is the single player mode of the game. I'd suggest getting each class to level II before you jump online, but at the very least you need to get each class to level I.Key bindings;These are the changes that I made, I feel that they make the game more intuitive. I disable weapons selection of via middle mouse button, and I use the numbers 1 through 4 keys for that purpose.I use mouse scroll to throw money. It is much easier to roll the mouse, than trying to spam a button.I set voice communication to my thumb (back button) on the mouse.I did a re-bind of my right mouse button, and changed it from toggle weapons to zoom, to Quick Iron Sights.Wow. I ran out of room. I had m...

er 14, 2014
												6-Man Co-op shooter against waves of increasingly strong Zeds. Soon to be a decade old, this game still has a bunch of people playing. Never do I log on and don't see servers of my chosen difficulty.Pros:-Awesome Fun-7 Perks to choose from, each requires a good xp grind to hit max rank-Tons of maps and a good selection of weapons to use-Huge modding community adding maps/weapons/skins-Tripwire still updates the game with Holiday events and new DLC equipementCons:-Modding Character/weapon skins will sometimes disable perk progression until the game is launched again -Higher difficulty = more enemies that have even more HP and move faster-Due to the Xp grind, a casual player may not level up for months when trying to hit the higher ranks9 types of zeds will make their appearance during your games. Each zed is unique and will try to eat you in some fashion. Where the basic clot is no threat alone, being cornered by a fleshpound can definitly ruin your day. Some zeds require coordination to take out, as does kiting the map if you don't have the fire power to camp one spot. For the fun factor and survivability, this game is definitly worth it's price. Killing Floor 2 is on it's way, time to practice zed disposal!

content:
, 2011
												Killing Floor, to me, is one of the best co-op designed games I've played to date. The game brings out all the classic, well-known weapons of shooters into the mix. Killing Floor revolves and works around how many players are in the game (1-6) and each wave of enemies increases in numbers the further you get. The more people that are in the server, the harder the final Patriarch boss is to kill.The game has many classes and plenty of characters to choose from and you can level them up from 0-6 as you play them more frequently. If you're looking for a game that has all sorts of classes that master in almost any type of weapon out there, Killing Floor is the game for you. Perfect for when your only objective is to just kill things with your friends!

content:
er 30, 2014
 Killing Floor Review  Short Decription  Killing Floor is truly a masterpeice of a game,a simple but yet fun and addictive game to play with yourself and with your friends!. Killing Floor is a 6 player co-op horde shooter where you battle it out with waves of mutated genetic freaks and earn money for oblidorating them and using that money to buy better gear between waves at the Trader.Killing Floor also features a Perk System which has 7 diffrent perks to pick from  ( Field medic, Support specialist, Sharpshooter, Commando, Berserker, Firebug and Demolition.)  with each level you earn, the higher the benefits of your perk will be, getting you more discounts on perk specific weapons and more damage for those weapons and other perk related attributes of the sort. Run down of the Game  Multiplayer The comunnity for Killing Floor is large and healthy, many active players and active servers to join and play injust make sure to play on servers appropriate for your level of skill and perk, playing on Hell on earth servers is not exactly where you wanna start your game in. Mod support/Developer support Killing Floor has been supported by the developers ever since 5 years ago when it came out on Steam, giving a large amount of patches and fixes for the game along with a ton of Weapons that were added in during special events (Christmas, Halloween, ect) also re-skinning the zeds to fit the theme of the holiday.in terms of mods Killing Floor itself was originaly built off a Mod for Unreal2004 so it would be no suprise to see the game have very big mod support, a ton of community made maps and other mods (Weapons, Charaters, Zeds, ect)i would recommend to play a bit of Killing Floor Vanila before trying out the mods so that you will not be confused what is a regular part of the base game. Performance  For a game running on an outdated/aging engine, Killing Floor is quite amazing till this very day.using the old unreal engine to its limits and allowing huge mod support with the SDK.Running Killing Floor should not be a problem to anyone with a low-end PC, (unless you are trying to run the game with a Potato of a computor) Gameplay Killing Floor is quite a solid and polished FPS, having some of the best gunplay i have ever expirenced in a gamegiving the player a large amount of options and guns to use.Teamwork is a very important part of the game when playing on higher diffculties or playing in general with other poepleeveryone in the team has a responsibility to take and can contribute to the team with the skill set they have(Field medic healing poeple (duhh). Support keeping doors welded and crowd controling zeds with his shotgun, Demolition blowing ♥♥♥♥ up, ect ect) Final notes Killing Floor is definetly a must have for any fan of horde shooters and cooprative games, you will be playing for hours and might want to get a group of friends to enjoy it twice as much!like i said before, please know what you are doing and dont go running off into Hell on Earth servers at Level 0you also might wanna pick up some weapon DLC, (yeah we all hate buying DLC but this DLC is realy good and the developers deserve the money for this!) there is also alot of cosmetic charater packs you can pick up to add a bit of style to your charater, but they aren't essential nor do you get any special benefits from them.I can't wait for Killing Floor 2 and i bet you can't wait aswell, so hop into Killing Floor and have a blast and prepare your ♥♥♥ for Killing Floor 2.UPDATE 11/18/2016kf2 got out of EA, sucks ♥♥♥♥ not going to elaborate, play kf1 instead

content:
2015
												I really love this game. Is it kind of a grind? Yea but if you really hate the grind, you can easily DL a perk leveler map and train your stats if it bothers you that much.Is this game repetitive? Sure but that's also a key factor which makes it great. You know what is going to happen but on the harder levels, the antsy feeling of running away and shooting or barricading yourself in somewhere never goes away and that's awesome.Really just a big sandbox game. A lot of fun without friends but if you have friends, it is way more fun. The teamwork you get on some servers to stick together and watch everyone's backs is awesome and hilarious. I put this game down sometimes because of how repetitive it is but I always come back for more. Hopefully Killing Floor 2 will just learn from the few mistakes this game had and make a better version.If i were to recommend a game that's wave-based, shoot-em-up with twenty-five or more guns that you use efficiently against armies of failed experiments that give you bounty cash when you kill them, so you can kill that in horrifically more brutal ways with better guns, as they slowly upgrade their army with bigger baddies until you fight an all-mighty boss that could rekt you without blinking, I'd recommend Killing Floor. Seriously, this game is my TOP FAVORITE, just because of how enjoyable it is. Yes, it may be old, and yes, it's not graphically impressive, but it's a damn good game. It has me STILL playing, even after hitting rank six with every class and gaining every annoying ♥♥♥♥ing achievement.Why do i keep playing? Because it's fun, and because my friends have/love it. Playing by yourself on Hell on Earth, doesn't compare to the simple mayhem of playing with 6, or 64 other players (depending on what player-based mods are installed.) And, if you don't like the original ZEDS, you can re-mold them with extremely well-done mods like the Killing Floor: Dead Space mod, or the Aliens mod, to fight more horrific creatures. Hell, they even have mods to make the game ALMOST like DOOM. There is weapon mods, character re-skins, maps, VEHICLES, and so many other amazing things. This game gets a 10/10, no matter how people string the BS. It's a great game, and has some amazing re-play value when you're trying new things out. Multiplayer is fun, single player is fun, and PLEASE don't say that popping a ZED's head of with a M99 ISN'T satisfying. 10/10 best zombie shooter genre game of 2009-2015 (KF 2 EA in april of 2015)

												This is indeed a very underrated game. Sure the graphics are outdated and the objective can get a bit repetitive but that aside Killing Floor has a superb and addictive gameplay, especially in multiplayer. To compare it with L4D or L4D2 is not really fair in my opinion. I love both those games, but Killing Floor just gives you so much with so little effort. It's a bit like in some games where you can almost sense the scripting kind of guides you through the game or dictates what you need to do. Here the premise is much more simple: "I'll throw a bunch of weapons and zombies out there - you just stay alive, I don't care how". It's primitive but immensely satisfying and it still get's updated with new and cheap content.Great Game buy it

content:
ry 17, 2014
												Killing floor is a wave based zombie shooter with 8 different types of zombies/mutants and a player limit of 6 or so (many more on modded servers though). Game play is basic you pick a perk (Demolitions (grenade launchers and my fav), Support (shotgun and welder), Sharpshooter (pistols and rifles), Berserker (Melee weapons), Pyro (flame based weapons), Medic (Obvious), Commando (Assault rifles). You can purchase weapons of any class at the end of a wave at a trader which is open for a variable amount of time based on settings. In addition to your weapons every class has a medic gun and a welder (both work only at melee range) but their effectiveness is based on your perk. You can weld certain doors and gates closed letting you hold off the horde that little while longer. Guns sound awesome, a decent variety for each class. You are limited by a weight limit for how many weapons you can carry though (not by slots). The base game has quite a few maps including a couple of objective maps as well as a few sandbox settings and difficulty levels. The base game is quite fun for the first few weeks but starts to get samey/grindy which is why i HIGHLY recommend to play on a modded server. There is also a lot of things on the workshop page (especially modded maps) which i also recommend checking out too. The workshop is why i kept playing from 30 hours onward. The game also has holiday orientated events (Halloween redneck zombies, evil Santa)Graphics are okay (game is a couple of years old) and it is very gory with no geo block :D. Which is why the demo class is so fun XD. Sounds are pretty good, guns feel nice (especially the 9mm). Maps vary from open, outdoors, corridors, small e.c.t so there is a lot of variety there. That about sums up KF, its simple but fun. I would recommend it (especially on sale), it also is still receiving updates. (Don't think i forgot anything).

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
29, 2015
												About Game:Killing Floor (abbreviated as KF) is a cooperative first-person shooter video game developed and published by Tripwire Interactive. It was originally released as an Unreal Tournament 2004 mod in 2005Gameplay:Killing Floor is a first person shooter, allowing each player to move through a 3D environment. Gameplay consists of two game types, in which the player fights waves of zombie-like specimens, with each wave becoming successively more difficult, until it concludes with a battle against a "boss" specimen, called the Patriarch. Players earn in-game money for each kill, as well as for surviving to the end of a wave. In the time between each waves, players can visit a trader to buy and sell ammo, armor, and additional weapons, such as katanas, pipe bombs, flamethrowers, shotguns, and so forth; the Trader's location on the level varies at the end of each wave, discouraging players from camping in one location. Weapons may also be found randomly across the level. Players are encouraged to work together; they can trade items and drop money, healing is more effective on other players than on oneself, and the team can strategically weld doors shut to provide a temporary barrier from the oncoming horde while funneling the other creatures to specific areas.Players select one of seven perks at the start of a match and between rounds. The perk, similar to the idea of a character class, provides bonuses towards certain weapon types, armor, movement, and other factors. Players can level up each perk to increase the benefits it offers. For example, the "Sharpshooter" perk, which provides accuracy benefits when using scoped rifles, can be raised in level by completing a number of headshots with specific weapons. The player does not need to play with that perk to raise its level; for example, the Field Medic perk requires the player to heal a number of points to level up, but this can also be done while playing any of the other perks.Players that die during a wave will drop their current weapon and re-enter the game at the start of the next wave, as long as at least one squad member survives. If the entire squad is wiped out, they will have to restart the game from the first round.Each game can be configured to alter the length and difficulty of the various waves. The number of creatures in the enemy waves are based on the number of players in the game, increasing in numbers if more players join the game in progress. All but the weakest enemies have some special attack that can inflict significant damage on a player. A feature called "zed time" awards particularly gory kills, such as headshots, with slow-motion, even in multiplayer mode.Plot:The game takes place in London, England. Horzine Biotech, a biotechnology company, is contracted to conduct experiments of a military nature involving mass cloning and genetic manipulation. Something goes horribly wrong during the process of the experimentations, and human subjects begin to exhibit grotesque mutations and disfigurement. They become increasingly hostile, and eventually overrun the internal security forces of the corporation.Hours later, the first waves of the specimens break out onto the surface, disrupting a peace protest outside the well-known military contractor. Despite the best efforts of local police, the civilians are quickly overwhelmed and consumed by the seemingly endless supply of clones now streaming from the gaping maw of Horzine Biotech's headquarter. Having escaped their sterile prison, the creatures began to fan out to neighboring areas, devouring the helpless citizens of London while the Metropolitan Police bravely but fruitlessly attempt to stem the tide of mutated flesh now spreading across their city.Desperate to contain the outbreak from reaching overseas as planned by the now mutated and cybernetic-enhanced scientist Dr. Kevin Clamely (which is now the Patriarch), the British government quickly begins to organize ragtag teams of surviving British Army soldiers and Special Branch police officers to fight back against the hordes of mutated "specimens" now running amok throughout the capital and its outskirts. The player takes the role of a member of one of these teams as they partake in a variety of missions in and around the city of London.My favorite and one of the best coop based multiplayer game ever! Make sure that you play with friends, fun is guaranteed!. Tripwire Interactive has done a great job with this game.Few events in year which include free maps is something that is rarely seen and a developer that is loyal to his fans!Loadsamoney!Money, money, money!Take some dosh!Money simulator 11/10Cant wait for Killing Floor 2 ^^

The base game has quite a few maps including a couple of objective maps as well as a few sandbox settings and difficulty levels. The base game is quite fun for the first few weeks but starts to get samey/grindy which is why i HIGHLY recommend to play on a modded server. There is also a lot of things on the workshop page (especially modded maps) which i also recommend checking out too. The workshop is why i kept playing from 30 hours onward. The game also has holiday orientated events (Halloween redneck zombies, evil Santa)Graphics are okay (game is a couple of years old) and it is very gory with no geo block :D. Which is why the demo class is so fun XD. Sounds are pretty good, guns feel nice (especially the 9mm). Maps vary from open, outdoors, corridors, small e.c.t so there is a lot of variety there. That about sums up KF, its simple but fun. I would recommend it (especially on sale), it also is still receiving updates. (Don't think i forgot anything).
