number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
er 28, 2013
												Killing Floor is an intense RPG/FPS that can take minutes to get into but hundreds of hours to become proficient at.  The game offers 5 difficulties, the lower of which you can be comfortable playing alone but the higher difficulties demand exceptional teamwork in order to overcome the grisly odds.  Seven different perks that grow in power as you level them up to six times allow you to choose the type of destruction you wish to bring to the mutant freaks.The combat includes anywhere from one to six players and the more people you have on your squad the larger the force and the bigger the healthpool of the opposition.  The menace you attempt to best with your buddies is as diverse as they are deadly.  Wave-based gameplay gradually introduces you to the specimens while giving you time to save up your dosh for spending at the games rather formidable armory.  While the game is four years old the developers still release brand new content for the game on a semi-regular basis, with seasonal updates that reskin the specimens you fight into hilariously creepy incarnations.  New characters, new weapons and new maps await even the veteran players every few months.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
ber 23, 2014
												Right, where do I start?Killing Floor is a Survival Co-op, wave based game that was originally a mod for Unreal Tournement 2004. The goal is to survive the waves by killing ♥♥♥♥. Killing ♥♥♥♥ earns money which then can be spent at the trader in-between waves for guns, ammo and armour. The game revolves around a perk system, players can pick a perk that can be helpful (or detrimental) to the team. Each perk usually has positives and negatives to using them. For example, Beserkers get up close and personal to hack and slash specimen and can soak up bits of damage. The Field Medic keeps the team alive by healing them via syringe injections and have very durable armour so can soak up damage if needed. Firebugs are great at crowd control by setting groups of specimen on fire to deal damage overtime and to slow them down and so on. However the perk you choose is not set in stone, you can switch in-between waves during trader time and also it sometimes helps to have off-perk weapons in some cases.The game is greatly optimized, it can play on most toasters with ease and comes with so many graphical options that even puts Twinnings teabag varieties to shame. The learning curve can be steep, I would advise playing on easy or normal difficulty to start with to get used to the mechanics. Most harder difficulty games (Suicidal and Hell On Earth) often require higher perk levels, practice makes perfect.Perhaps the main thing that keeps me coming back to this game is the modders. Modded servers are a whole new ball game with the inclusion of content such as maps, perks, specimen and weapons. The amount of new content on some of them are so extreme that you may not want to ever go back to stock. You have been warned!!!!With over 2.5k hours invested in the game so far, this is easily the game that I play the most and for a good reason.

content:
er 18, 2013
												Killing Floor tells the story of Booker T. DeWitt, a private detective hired to investigate the kidnapping of Dosh by an ancient race of sentient machines known as "The Reapers". The "Reapers" live underground and use emergence holes to access the world above. Aided by his old friend Victor Sullivan they must retrieve an item known as the Cintamani Stone in order to fight an invasion by a terrifying parasitic alien horde known as The Flood. The game Stars Bill Cosby as the voice of The Fleshpund and a musical score by Michael Buble and performances by the cast of smash hit broadway musical 'Cats'.Killing Floor is a quirky, indie romp with a fantastic performance from Ellen Page as Mr. Fosters love interest.I heartily recommend this game to anyone who loves 2d sidesrolling platformers

BUY.IT.FAST!Killing Floor is an Horror-Co-op Shooter in a post apocalyptic scenery. You play in Multiplayer with a group of 5 (max) other players. Choose your weapons, your tactic and your friends - and do it fast!Its wave based with stronger enemies spawning each wave and concludes with a final boss wave. Weapons are perk based and perks can be leveled persistently trough playing.For ME, it is the best Co-op game on STEAM. It isn't the holy apple - it has also some bugs or problems and the graphic is meh. But, it is addictive as hell (with a good team).++ very good Co-op based game++ huge variation of weapons, maps and characters++ always up to date++ lots of DLC++ high gore and blood factor (uncut version)++ if you play "Suicidal" or "Hell on Earth" - IT IS SUICIDAL OR HELL ON EARTH++ perk / level system - classes have unique roles, pros/cons, levelling is addictive++ events (christmas, halloween, summer..)+ many achievements+ nice sound effects and slow motion+ skill based+ doesn't get old or boring+ makes fun with or without other players!I love this game, but...- no telled story or campaign- DLC are expensive...one character for 3,99€!?- hasn't the nicest physics or graphic (but it's still ok!)- about 10 zombie kinds...not so many- got killed by evil creatures, not the floor...- should've learned something these 400 hours..."Killing Floor" - Thank you. 9,5/10

content:
r 20, 2014
												Are you bored of staying in one spot for 10 minutes straight, with hordes of zombies rampaging at your front door and with little ammo to spare?You've come to the right place. Kill specimens. They're not really zombies, we just like mutating things and hope for the best. Although, we did create this... abomination, and it's currently pinning us down with a big-♥♥♥ chaingun and this large rocket launcher. Oh, he said something for once in clear English, something like "One in the pi-"Still reading this? Want an actual review of this game? You've come to the next right place. Grab your pistol, give drugs to people, get dosh, buy weapons, survive, buy more weapons, experiment, melee things to death, it's got it all. With Killing Floor 2 coming out next year, and this week's update, this game cannot die. A good handful are still playing it daily, and you can even play by yourself.More of a strategy, if you're playing by yourself, any perk can be the best, even Field Medic. "But I'm not healing anyone!" you say. It's cause you gain awesome abilities by running as fast as a berzerker. Oh yeah, berzerking ravaging through fleshpounds with a claymore sword, we got a badass on the field.Now if you were playing with friends, now we need communication. A six player team can be done properly, if people are very good at this game, like a skilled elite of the FBI or something. Still, this game's got what it worth, and multiplayer is unforgetable.10/10

content:
er 27, 2013
												Don't be fooled by looking at this FPS and thinking that because it looks a bit dated, it isn't very good. Yes, it is indeed a few years old now but it still holds up VERY well today, despite there being numerous offerings in the wave-based FPS shooter (such as Left 4 Dead).This was one of my first purchases on Steam 3 years ago, and it was a gamble for me as it was on offer. It's also ended up being one of my most played games. It certainly has surprised me.It previously won the annual award for best Unreal Engine mod, and you can quickly see why when you get into it. At first, you might be surprised that it's so simplistic in it's offering - you fight of a series of progressively harder waves of "specimens" (don't say the "z" word!), culminating in a boss battle. There's a fair choice of pretty well-designed maps too.However, this game is much more than the mere sum of it's parts. There's a good choice of weapons - in many games, this wouldn't really mean a lot, but here they are not just clearly individual and well-balanced (so you can comfortably work with which ones suit your style), they have real heft, looking, sounding and feeling excellent. I'd go as far as to say these are probably one of the best examples of guns in a game - they are the real stars here.The game's real unique point lies in it's class system - each option will give you bonuses to the applicable weapons for that class (example: a Firebug will do extra damage with flamethrowers). This variety really lends itself well when in co-operative multiplayer; get the right balance on your squad of teammates and you can be a unit of near-invincible mince-making machines, especially when those classes can earn experience to level up, strengthening you further!Cash is earned for kills, which can be spent between waves on better guns. You have an inventory limit based on weight, so some juggling will be required. Thankfully, any cash you earn can be dropped for teammates to pick up, so late additions to your party won't be compromised. All this adds up to some quite excellent co-operation both in play and tactics.As I mentioned before, I bought this game some 3 years ago, and it was great value then. However, Tripwire have excelled in their support for this game. Every time there's a major Steam sale on, there's an event with a new map (and even new gameplay) all completely gratis! This has resulted in the content more than doubling in those 3 years, and the events still continue now.So, if you're an FPS fan, a co-operative multiplayer fan, or just a gun nut, it's absolutely recommended. There are a number of games of this ilk, but this one of the very finest examples. With the continued free content on offer, it makes this an essential purchase.

content:
23, 2016
												A little gem for some mindless killing fun or either a challenging horde fighting game to do with some friends or strangers, or simply by yourself, with the goal to survive many waves of monsters, until you and your teammates are the only living thing left in the map, with each wave getting tougher as more of these monsters will appear, together with stronger and nastier kind of them appearing as you progress in the game.The player will be given a character provided with the basic pistol and basic melee weapon in the game, and as soon the game starts you will be able to use these weak weapons to kill the first handful of monsters. As soon as you've done with this first wave, you will be given the way to go to the Trader, which will sell you many more and way stronger weapons that you can use, instead of your standard cookies and milk. Based on what "Perk" are you going to use, which is the skill level with a certain category of weapons that you can decide to specialize into, such as being better at using shotguns, assault rifles, or being better at healing or at using melee weapons, you will be given a wide variety of weapons that you should be supposed to use, but you can anytime change the kind of weapons you want to use, or completely change the Perk you're playing with. Each of these Perks will also give you a particular role in the game that you will easily find out just by playing it, which is also the way to improve said skills.There are a total of 9 kind of monsters you can encounter during a full game, each with many skills and characteristics meant to pose the players a certain kind of threat based on how dangerous these enemies are, with one last final one that is meant to be the "boss" of the game, the stronger of them all and your final goal to beat the game.In a summary this is the game, which can sound pretty simple and easy, but by playing in harder difficulties you will find out that it requires much strategy depending on the perks you and any of your teammates are playing, by the kind of enemies you have around and the situation you're in.It may be a pretty old game and may have lots of DLCs, which are almost all cosmetic characters or weapons while just 2-3 are actually different weapons, but these aren't that great and is usually better to stick with the ones present for everyone in the game.It's as of today a pretty fun game where many people are still playing on the servers, even with the new KF2 out.If you like a decent good old game that has also a workshop for some game modding that adds some variety to the game, and also runs smoothly even on the oldest computers, you've come to the right page.

content:
2014
												One of the best co-op games I have played in my entire life. Not enough games emphasize team-play like this one does. There are 7 perks you can play as, and all serve a specific purpose and have their own priority targets. On the lower difficulties it's not that important, but on the higher ones you really need a balanced team to make it through. Each of these perks can be levelled up, giving you several bonuses which make the game generally easier. It's also an addicting mechanic that more survival/horde games should have. The soundtrack kicks so much ♥♥♥ too. I also really like the developers because they do something special every holiday, like releasing a new map and adding a new unlockable character. But there are also thousands of custom maps and other mods made by the community to use. The game goes on sale with a huge discount so often, and you get so much value and content for your money.If I have one complaint about this game the way it is now, then it's that it doesn't look as dark and scary as the original mod did. The maps looked a lot darker and really seemed like how places would look during a scenario like this. It had a better atmosphere, in my opinion. The new maps just look too clean, but they are designed better in the sense of enemy spawn points and being able to survive on them.

r 29, 2015
												Awesome Coop-game, it is still fun even after years of playing it. It used to have a rock-paper-scissor-like approach, whith each class having unique strenghts and weaknesses making the game very teamplay-demanding. Those were the great time of KF, very hard to beat on the highest difficulty level with a lot of knowledge and teamplay required to make it through the map. Unfortunately, the Devs removed the classes`weaknesses and now every perk can kill every zed and team selection doesnt matter anymore. But it stil is a lot of fun to play and there will be still some challenges for newer players but the veterans will need to play on modded servers like ScrN-Hardcore. Every PC-gamer should definitely have this game in his library!

content:
ber 22, 2014
												Welcome to my review of Killing Floor. Now, I could go on and on with some boring review, but why do that when I can just be straight to the point?This here is Killing Floor. This is a game where you, to great surprise, kill things. In fact, you kill a lot of things. To be honest, I hope you like killing things, because that's this game's primary feature!Not entirely 100% positive what the things are? Don't worry, because we aren't either! Before you know it, you too, will be mindlessly firing the portable killing machine of your choice beside others who share your newly obtained urge to fire weapons at mutants without questioning the logic of why you're a military operative sent against mutants with nothing but a Beretta M9, a knife, a welding tool, and a healing injector that magically recharges over time!What do you do? Simple! You kill things. Once you're done killing things, you get weapons from the money you got from killing things so you can kill more things and earn MORE money to get BETTER weapons to kill more things with, until you finally kill enough things to get to the big thing called the patriarch. By then, hopefully your squad of originally highly unprepared, lighthearted, talkative british soldiers will have killed enough things to get powerful enough weapons to stand a chance against this final mutant! What happens when you win, you ask? You do it all over again! Astonishing, correct?How do you get weapons? Like any fully-unprepared squad of six brits would in an apocalypse! You trust a completely legitimate travelling mercenary who has no affiliation with the army, that conveniently manages to travel from shop to shop for absolutely no reason since it's all within the same small area, without ever having to fight any of the mutants you're facing! We should also note that she is the only living person in the game aside from your squad, so it's your job to make sure that you clean out these completely decimated areas so the people that don't live anymore can be free!But killing things with portable killing machines is just not enough! The game uses a class system. Now, I could use the actual names, but who needs names to confuse people, when we're already throwing logic out the window?! Lets just use fancy, informative descriptions!Our fabulous classes include:Brits who shoot things with automatic weapons and can see invisible women.Brits who heal people with the same automatic weapons they kill things with, while tanking damage like no one else ever could.Brits who burn things.Brits who blow things up.Brits who blast things with shotguns and carry more than anyone else.Brits who snipe enemies from afar and fail to realize pistols are actually powerful in this game.And lastly, Brits who run really fast and use melee weapons to attack the enemies that are also primarily limited to melee attacks!Should you play long enough to level a class up really far, the queen will smile upon your efforts and no longer send you in with just a Beretta M9 and a knife to fight with on the first wave - instead, she will provide you with a weapon for your class that is significantly more useful! In addition, levelling up causes the goddess of guns to bless your firearms that match your class with improved firepower! No, she doesn't give you new kinds of bullets, or modifications to the guns, they just magically obtain greater potential! It makes perfect sense if you don't think about it, and why would you?! Your thoughts should be focused on killing mutants, you bloody fool!But make no mistake - this is NOT a first person shooter! No, this is in fact a killing simulator. That's right, a killing simulator! You aren't just shooting these mutants, it's up to you whether or not you take limbs off their torsos, blast their heads off, decapitate them, burn them alive, or blast them to little bits! Be creative with how you kill mutants, just don't give them the opportunity to be creative as well!Need more guns? Of course you do! That's why there's three weapon pack DLCs! Don't like DLCs? No problem! Turn to modding, and make Killing Floor's battles into an even bigger massacre than they already are!So what are you waiting for? Throw away your logic, bring your friends, lose your social life, and get to slaughtering mutants over and over, because who needs reasons anyway?!

content:
er 10, 2011
												(Just a small, positive review)This game is the reason I hopped on Steam almost 4 years ago.A truly unique experience with perfect teamplay elements!It has a round-based system in which the game works, you need to survive each round, kill high priority enemies before taking down the smaller ones. And the harder modes would definitely require you to use tactics - which can be ruined by selfish/inept people though.For each enemy & round you complete, you get money which you can then use at the trader to buy weapons, armor & grenades - they are discounted based on how high your specific class is.At the end of the round you will fight the Patriarch, a boss that can be quite dangerous if the team doesn't coordinate well or doesn't have the right classes to fight/distract it.(Also, I made a lot of Steam friends via this game!)I'd recommend playing Killing Floor before getting Killing Floor 2, since this game was the basis on which Killing Floor 2 was based - which is a great game, in it's own right.Personal score: 7.5/10Best regards,Dukhat

												It's hard to some up Killing floor. It's a zombie game with a steam punk feel and an 'old school' play style wich makes you fall in love. It takes practice and lots of skill to play this game. Teamwork is nearly essential and you will learn to help others and be aware of their situation because your survival also depends on it. Headshots however, are deffinitely essentia and accuracy and timing are very important. Killing floor 2 is not comparable to this game and in my opinion the sequel lost the old school charm and is more an entirely different game rather than a sequel. That not to say KF2 is a bad game it is still a good game, its just different.You will be eaten and die constantly. You will watch those you love be eaten. you will run faster with your knife. Until the Patriarch finds you.  Say hi Patty!

												Oh Killing Floor, For it's time, it was a legend using a mod from the unreal engine, and it proved useful for many years. Although the AI move patterns go off from time to time, Killing Floor is still one of the best games still currently played even though it's graphics are low for today's standards, and not being next gen. However, the creativity of the ways to kill the, "zeds," makes it one of the key factors of it's high playability. The way that the Zed's heads can be chopped off, blown up, or simply hacked to death. It provides those who may not have the high graphics card, or players sick of just shooting zombies  in the head for a kill, the chance to play a game that is just a bundle of little giblet goodies.

content:
er 19, 2013
												Killing Floor is a game that I pick up every now and then, and always end up wondering, "Why don't I play this more often?" The weapons are very satisfying to use, and every enemy in the game can be a reasonable threat. The final boss is among the most lethal of that I have ever seen (despite the fact that there are ways of easily beating him), as he is: faster than you, has an instant-kill rocket launcher attack, a minigun that has a chance of killing you in a burst (about a second), and melee attacks that brutalize you/send you flying away. This game is especially fun with friends, and the 7 (pretty sure it's 7) classes are all useful in some respect. I highly recommend picking up this game at sometime, especially if it goes on sale.

												I've always compared this game to Left 4 Dead, the games being similar in terms of gameplay. But, I have to say Killing Floor it's amazing! The game is pretty popular, lots of characters to play as and lots of weapons to try out, tons of maps and community maps, DLC's and seasonal game mods for Christmas, Halloween etc.The game is fun by itself even when playing with strangers, but it's even more fun when playing with buddies, since for me the game is pretty scary when I find myself alone angaist tons of enemies. content:
3, 2014
												This is a surprisingly addictive coop, fps, wave-based, zombie survival.Unlike most games Killing Floor simply acknowledges that it is a game. There are multiple types of zombies with their own unique abilities, but not anything special. The game has a good variety of guns and maps, and a perk-based leveling up tree. The amount of achievements is off the wall. With over 250 of them, it's very hard to get bored of this game.Now, the only down side to all of these happy notes. DLC. $8 a pop for nothing but a retextures. $8 for a 4-pack of player models, that do nothing but change the way you look. $8 for a 4-pack of golden weapons that are the same as their in-game equivalents. The only thing that may be col is the community weapons pack, but even for a crossbow that shoots rotary saws... Not worth $8.BUT, that's not an in-game problem, SO BUY KILLING FLOOR NOW!

content:
er 21, 2010
												Killing Floor is an FPS Zombie Killing Game that gives you 6 different perks to choose from. Once you have chosen a perk, you can switch anytime in between waves of the current game or while in the lobby. The game is kind of like Horde from Gears of War or Firefight from Halo 3: ODST in being that you fight against waves of enemies and then against a boss at the end of the last wave. You get to level up each perk to a maximum of 6 levels and with each level, you get really cool benefits. At the end of each wave, you can buy weapons/armor/grenades from this shop that opens up at random locations throughout the map. There's only a certain amount of time to shop and the higher the difficulty, the less time..this means that if you're far away from the shop before it opens...you're screwed! Overall, this is a really fun game, it has excellent gameplay and gore, and it's worth the buy!

content:
er 18, 2013
												Simply put, if you enjoy First Person Shooters, Survival Games, Co-op, or horror, you will LOVE Killing Floor.This game sports a variety of weapons, each designed for a "Class". When you start a match, you can choose a Perk, making you suited for a role (ex. Medic, Support Specialist, and Commando), you can change the perk at any time though, and you level up the perks gradually, helping you face harder difficulties (which you can select at any time). As a team, or alone, you face waves of genetically modified clones, that each have unique traits (for example, one type can cloak, another can walk on walls and leap far distances). At the end wave, you fight a "Boss" of sorts, that has a rocket launcher on its shoulder, and a chaingun for an arm. Yeah, it can be as hard as it sounds. That's how a standard match goes, but as of late, objective based maps have also been introduced, and the Developers make special events for holidays and seasons, and also update things just for the sake of supporting the game, and adding new stuff. You can also shake things up a bit with mods, which you can easily get on the Steam Workshop. Mods include maps (which can have objectives or special things like acid floors, for instance), weapons, character models, and even unique gamemodes, like one that is directly based on the Aliens franchise. Overall, I would say that it is a very addicting game with extensive support from the developers and the community. It is also fairly cheap, and honestly, it is not much of a risky buy, because it is honestly just so addicting (coming from a FPS lover).

												This is my second played game in Steam for a reason, and my favorite CO-OP game of all time. But before I say it, I would just advise every new potential player to the game that they should at least play 3-4 matches in multiplayer on normal difficulty on an easy map such as Offices, Biotics Lab or West London, before they quit due to frustration with the difficulty.The simple reason this simple game with simple graphics and with a simple concept, is how well it is executed. You HAVE to cooperate in order to win, and on hard and above(even on normal if you are below lv2) you simple cannot win without reasonably distributed perks and some knowledge on the enemies.I keep coming back and play regulary with my friends because I like coordinating with one another without even speaking, and managing to get out of difficult situations due to teamwork.

content:
8, 2013
												Killing Floor is a cooperative wave-based shooter which features up to six players working together to take on up to 11 waves of opponents. Unlike other cooperative "zombie shooters," this game does not reward the soloist; instead often resulting in other players seeing the message "[this guy] was killed by [this thing]" and occasionally sparking a "rage quit." But this does not mean the game is not enjoyable; in fact quite to the contrary. The necessity of teamwork really brings the entire game together and gives you lots of reasons to experiment and work with the different classes.Of the seven classes available, you will often see the server divided into four or five of them; with at least one medic if the team is to survive. Each class not only benefits the player but forms a perfect synergy with the others and creates a real squadron feeling to the entire game. While the game rewards a balanced team where everyone plays to their strengths; it also works to the contrary and punishes those who don't work together or are glad to abandon their team-mate's sides.Weapons are widely varied and mostly benefit from their specific perks (Commando class users benefit from perks boosting the effectiveness of Assault/Battle Rifles; for example) but aren't exclusive to those classes. A demolitions user isn't limited to just explosives; while a medic can just as happily carry a shotgun, which benefits the players greatly. While classes do help, it isn't uncommon to see people branching out with their weapons in order to keep the benefits of one class while levelling their progress towards another (you don't need to be a specific class to earn progress in it). There are a wide variety of weapons available, including fire axes; handguns; crossbows; grenade launchers; shotguns; assault rifles and even medic guns which allow the user to heal players from a distance by firing medical darts with the guns secondary fire and EVERYONE has access to that most sacred of crowd control methods: the Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch (okay, maybe I exaggerate... Maybe it's just a standard fragmentation grenade, but one can dream?).In terms of maps, in addition to the original maps included in the release; subsequent FREE map releases have increased the map count from the original five to the current twenty-eight official maps; which means the game has at least 560% more content than it did, not counting the new weapons or events which run every so often. Games can range from the confined corridors of the Biotics Lab, to the open streets of West London, even stretching as far (and obscurely) as the Evil Santa's Lair!There'll be at least one map which ought to bring you some enjoyment; although each map is designed in such a charming way that the tactics can be transferred from one to the next; so long as you find the right spot to use the old tactic.Enemy variety is something which is important, but this game doesn't offer hundreds of unique enemies, or procedural spawning. It's not that they aren't good ideas, but rather that they're just unnecessary in this game. The enemies come at you wave after wave and while they start spawning undoubtedly tougher enemies, they still give you that bit of cannon fodder to distract you. The cannon fodder though, should be taken seriously in every case. Even the clots (most likely the first specimen you'll ever encounter; at least for your sake I hope so) can take down an experienced player if they don't pay attention. Every enemy has a special ability, which can range from the nuisance of the clots grabbing you and stopping you from moving to the Fleshpound's "rage mode," which can reduce even the most dedicated Macho Man Randy Savage enthusiasts to a quivering pile of diuretic mound of man-flesh in only a few unstructured (and oddly effeminate scream filled) seconds.But no specimen is above being pulverised by a well-oiled machine, which can come from even the most ragtag band of misfits.All in all, this game hasn't changed much from it's 2005 release as a standalone mod for Unreal Tournament 2004; but this is in no way to it's detriment. In fact, it retains the wonderful charm of the mod but with the added bonus of so much free content (yes, there's paid DLC; but considering how much free stuff has been added, I can't say that they haven't earned the right to release it) and the wonderful balancing of every aspect of the game; the game still earns regular playtime from myself (having been a player since I first downloaded 1.0 back in 2006; back when it was much grimier) and will continue to do so. If your computer was good enough to run Unreal Tournament 2004 back in the day; I fail to see a reason why you'd NOT wish to purchase this title.Oh and to top it off, if achievements are your thing; get ready to sink a tremendous amount of time into earning all 252 and counting!

r 27, 2013
												Spectacular Cooperative Shooter Zombie game! Its filled with tons of exciting new contents every Summer, Halloween and Christmas! Perks are classes and there are only 6 Player classes mean you can easily adjust your playing style if its not working. Slashing your way with a melee weapon as a Berserker, burning the Specimens as a Firebug, you want to blow some explosives? sure you can be a Demolition! You want to do some headshots, pistols or sniping? Be a Sharpshooter! You can mow them down using a Shotgun or Wield the door to trap your teammates as a Support Specialist! Tired of not seeing Stalkers, want to see how much of any specimens have health bar left? lead your comrades to victorious? be a Commando! Lastly, are you in a pain that your teammates is always dying in the middle of the fight and you really want to help them and heal them? be a Field Medic! There are lots of fire arms in this game regarding DLC's weapons, tag along with your friends to battle in the open field map, fending off against the specimens horde until the Patriarch appeared in the last hour...Rated: 9.5/10

er 23, 2016
												This is my second played game in Steam for a reason, and my favorite CO-OP game of all time. But before I say it, I would just advise every new potential player to the game that they should at least play 3-4 matches in multiplayer on normal difficulty on an easy map such as Offices, Biotics Lab or West London, before they quit due to frustration with the difficulty.The simple reason this simple game with simple graphics and with a simple concept, is how well it is executed. You HAVE to cooperate in order to win, and on hard and above(even on normal if you are below lv2) you simple cannot win without reasonably distributed perks and some knowledge on the enemies.I keep coming back and play regulary with my friends because I like coordinating with one another without even speaking, and managing to get out of difficult situations due to teamwork.

er 26, 2013
												I love zombie / apacolypse survival games. Killing floor is no different. Multiplayer and servers can be tricky to set up, but Killing Floor is worth it. Awesome class / character progression system to fit multiplayer or singleplayer roles. Several different zombie types keep the game interesting. There's also a wide variety of unlockable guns and DLC guns for each class.I'm also a big fan of welding doors shut to temporarily hold off the impending doom. The difficulty levels are great in case the game gets too easy (or hard). I definetly recommend this game if you like survival / apocalypse shooters.

content:
5, 2011
												Killing Floor (Co-Op Survival Horror): teamwork, teamwork and more teamwork!  Did I forget to mention teamwork ? This game by Tripwire Interactive stresses the need to  field  a team of players that have acquired specific game skills/weapons ( beserker, commando, demolition, firebug, medic, sharpshooter, and support ) in order  to   collectively eliminate  all of the various zombies, from the mild mannered flesh eaters to the rocket/plasma shooting nutters. No one player/skill does it all. Player specific skills over time may be upgraded from level 1 through 6 if a positive number of game performance statistics are accumulated. The game levels are beginner, normal, hard, suicide and hell on earth, played on various maps.At just over 300 game hours, I've only begun to scratch the surface of this amazing game. Players of CS, DOD,L4D and any other FPS  game types will enjoy the constantly changing/varied gameplay. Every game is different! At $20.00 this game is a bargain (watch for sales

3, 2012
												Killing Floor is an arcadey first person shooter where teamwork is important. This game has very satisfying headshot moments. Once you get a headshot, there's a chance that the game would go in slow-motion, giving you more time to aim; and if someone gets another headshot using their class' weapon, the slo-mo chain would keep going.As the game progress, more zombie types are introduced and soon, you'll be killing hundreds of zombies, each with their own strengths and weaknesses that your team have to take into account so you won't get into a bad spot. And believe me, most party kills are caused by bad positioning as the zombies corner everyone.Good game, highly recommended!

content:
er 31, 2011
												One of the most addicting co-op shooters on PC.  Killing Floor started out as an average game, but with continuing community support and countless updates from Tripwire, Killing Floor has been made into a near perfect piece of work.  The variety of guns, perks, maps, and crazy people online will make certain that Killing Floor never becomes a dull experience. Countless community mods have kept me playing this hundreds of hours later, with everything from new maps, enemies and weapons, to 40 player servers and campaigns.  Killing Floor is not the nicest looking game, graphically, but that almost serves to fit the atmosphere even more.  Unfortunately, internet is a must with this game, as solo play gets dull fast.  All in all though , a must have. 9.5/10

content:

Product received for free
												I initially didn't like this game. However, looking back, it's because I only played solo rather than multiplayer. I even wrote a negative review, then put the game down. Skip forward several months later and one of my friends asked if I wanted to play with him. And accepting that invitation changed my opinion of the game completely. Killing Floor is meant to be played with others, and through this game I can live out my fantasy of being a back-row team healer via the Field Medic class. Of course, there are 6 other classes to choose from, each one suiting a certain playstyle; it's almost guaranteed you'd find a class that suits your preferred weapon(s) of choice.The online community for this game is like none I've ever seen before; everyone is supportive of eachother and all seem to share the same goal; kick zombie ♥♥♥ and help themselves (as well as others) improve. In all my time playing, I've never joined an online multiplayer lobby with even one person resembling that of the stereotypical toxic immature 'troll'. For being a relatively older game, there online community is still very active, which is great.

content:
er 5, 2013
												A fast-paced, Co-op oriented splatter fest where you and up to 5 other people fight to stay alive amid waves of grotesque medical experiments. Your classes give you specific bonuses that level up as you fight and support your team. There is a wide variety of maps and (cosmetic) characters to choose from. Weapon selection is extremely varied and shot discipline is /KEY/. That's not to say you can't spray and pray or open up with a weapon like the flame thrower, but a series of well aimed pistol shots can be extremely effective at clearing a group.If you love working together as a team I cannot express just how awesome a game this is. Also, Tripwire Interactive is extremely community oriented and conducts several Holiday events a year. Enemies are re-skinned, maps/weapons are added, along with character-skin unlocking Achievements.

content:
r 25, 2014
												Ahhh, Killing Floor, where do I begin?Back during the christmas steam sale of 2013 my friends and I decided to get this game when it went on sale. Back then we just thought, hey it's a multiplayer game, and it looks pretty cool. We never thought we would sink as much time into this game as we have.It used to hang at the initial load up screen for ages, but even then it worth the 2 minutes of black screen to wait to play this game, the gameplay its self is addictive and enjoyable, the leveling system is a bit too high on the grinding curve if you ask me, once you get to level 4 in the different classes it just drags. I am stoked to see what the next game will bring to the table.Also, what is up with the dialogue, specifically with the trader? Why does she say things like;I like the big ones, don't you?The shop is open, boys; come get me!They're all dead! It's time to go shoppin'!Come and get 'em! Lovely big guns!I'll tool you up, just right.4 of the 5 of those dialogues are definitly spoken with a naughty overtone of sorts, i'm not complaining by any means, at this point its a great joke between my friends and I quoting her and laughing. Anyways, you won't regret getting it, and I am looking forward to Killing Floor 2.

content:
, 2014
												First of all I would just say that Killing Floor (KF) is a very good game if you are looking for somehting to do when you are bored or just want to kill some monsters.  Positive GraphicsGameplayMany mapsMultiplayer Negative Class balanceHigh level requirments (level 5 and up)So lets talk about why I think all those things are positive and negative. The graphics are looking good and really fits this type of game without feeling strange and missplaced. When it comes to the gameplay I think that the monsters are balanced and there is always a challenge in trying to win but ofcourse that depends on what difficulty you are playing on(!). There is alot of map and plenty more to be downloaded that have been made by others, you will not get bored easily with all these maps. The multiplayer works really well and does almost always work without any problem, sometimes some friends have trouble joining the server even when there is no problem from our side but hey that does not happen often so no point in complaining to much about it.So why do I think that the class balance is bad? For example the berseker can run around and 1-hit most of the monsters without breaking a sweat while other classes have to shoot like a madman to kil them. But that also depends on where you shoot. Also the bonuses each class get when they reach level 5 is kinda unbalanced. The medic gets a body armor while others gets weapons that are worth more, that is not really nice but still a body armor is atleast something. When you reach level 5 as a medic you have to heal 2.5x the amount you have healed to reach level 5 just to get to level 6 which is a big leap. It takes a while depending on how much you play but I guess that they don't everyone to reach the high levels so fast.

content:
3
												Definitely recommending this game. Grab a few friends, hop in to a same server and just start shooting everything that attacks you.Killing floor offers a Great deal of fun in the shape of killing a lot of different types of mutated beings.It has a wide variety of weapons and classes, leveling up a class requires you to do certain things (eg. Sharpshooter needs to get headshots, Medic needs to heal), classes are well varied, every class feels unique and has their own weapons (Every gun is still possible to buy even if you're playing a certain class, but the class bonus' do not apply to other classes weapons).Game feels good, overall the movement is fluid, and getting that headshot on a bloater to blow up it's head feels awesome.Difficulty is easily adjusted, easy feels easy, and Hell on Earth offers a great deal of challenge.The game is also very well modded and it offers a lot of content on top of the classic game's content,DLC's are also a thing, they offer more weapons, if you're not satisfied with the defaults. I myself don't own any DLC, so I cannot give a proper review on that, but as far as I know, they are not considered overpowered.Overall, I prefer the First Killing floor over the second one, if you're not too bothered by "lower" graphics, I'd definitely give it a go.

content:
er 16, 2013
												KIlling Floor isn't just your average FPS.  Improving your stats, and not to mention, surviving the game takes a lot of patience and even more teamwork.  The replay value is high thanks to Perks (character classes) that take an incredible but worthwhile amount of time to level up, a wide range of weapons to experiment (or toy!) with and different maps.  A good deal of knowledge about the game mechanics is necessary to make it through the extermination runs, but that's where friends come in handy.  When playing with a team you can trust, then win or lose, the experience is just amazing!
